task.title: Running the PSC during development
task.shortdesc: You'll, most likely, want to run your client to test it during development. That's easy to do using the tc-cli.

taskbody.prereq: This requires a PSC and and installation, either locally in the PSC or globally, of the tc-cli. This is automatically pre-configured and installed when using a PSC bootstrapped using tc-cli init.

step.cmd: Open a terminal in your PSC folder

step.info: This runs tc-cli start. You can, instead, also run that command directly, allowing you to specify further options.

taskbody.result: The files get transpiled by webpack and the PSC opens in a new window. If you make any changes to your files, the files automatically re-transpile and the window reloads, including your changes.
